title.narrative: (909.1) GENDER EQUALITY

description.narrative: Gender Equality' - Barriers and bottlenecks identified and responded to that fuel gender differences in education, bias towards sons and devaluation of daughters, the gender dynamics linked to adolescent suicides, and stronger integration of gender into resilience strategies and disaster risk reduction and emergency preparedness., which contributes to Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Cross sectoral and Development Effectiveness

participating-org.narrative: ARISTOTELIO PANEPISTIMIO THESSALONI EIDIKOS LOGARIASMOS KONDILION EREVN

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Gender Equality? - Barriers and bottlenecks identified and responded to that fuel gender differences in education, bias towardssons and devaluation of daughters, the gender dynamics linked to adolescent suicides, and stronger integration of gender intoresilience strategies and disaster risk reduction and emergency preparedness.

description.narrative: Completion of over 95% of ECARO gender work plan activities for FY 2021 with support to integration of gender into country planning documents and results framework. Key results include;support to 8;country offices for CPDs and Gender Programmatic Reviews, inputs to UNICEF’s new Gender Action Plan;and Policy, roll out of regional gender strategy with change pathways for addressing gender equality, provided country gender profiles for all 22 offices, delivered;10 gender capacity sessions to all country offices and enhanced multi-regional collaborations on Girls Skills, STEM and Digital interventions with over 6 multi regional learning sessions and partnerships on gender equality. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/02/2022
